pageContext.claim: “Farm incomes are projected to rise by more than $10 billion from the day I was elected.”
pageContext.analysis: Net farm income largely has generally been increasing since 2003 and largely reflects changes in the commodity markets. Still, Trump says farm incomes are projected to increase “by more than $10 billion from the day I was elected.” USDA does not provide monthly data on farm incomes — only yearly data, and if they did, Trump’s assertion still includes the last several months of the Obama administration. A more accurate measure would only include the time since Trump took office and in that time, net farm income has declined $5.8 billion. (If you include all of 2016, it rose by $7.9 billion from 2016 to 2019.)
